subject: Sexual Health
title: The Male Condom
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Male Condom usable.

hook.text: The condom is the only contraceptive that also protects against most sexually transmitted infections.

buildup.text: Modern latex condoms are thin, strong, and tested to withstand pressure far beyond normal use.

discovery.text: With perfect use, condoms are 98% effective at preventing pregnancy. Typical use drops to about 82%.

twist.text: Most condom failures are due to incorrect use, not manufacturing defects. Education closes the gap.

climax.text: Condoms remain the most widely used contraceptive in the world because of their dual protection.

punchline.text: Dual protection: pregnancy and STIs in one step.

quiz.question: What makes condoms unique among contraceptives?
